title: ostrze 1
paragraphs: to jest historia miłosna
papierowych dłoni
i metalowych nożyczek

title: ostrze 2
paragraphs: papierowa ręka
nie cofa się
i nie lęka
być przecięta

title: the past
paragraphs:
i used to be
i used to feel
i used to like
i used to see
i used to do
i used to want
and i used to live

title: w powijakach
paragraphs:
Dwieście tysięcy lat
samoświadomych małp.
Samotne, kosmiczne niemowlęta,
czy ktokolwiek je zapamięta?

title: gatunek
paragraphs:
Dzieci umarłych gwiazd,
gatunek "ludzki".
Jedno pytanie:
czy było warto?

title: the collective
paragraphs:
Do not mourn the atoms
that once called themselves my name;
they were just borrowed for a short while.
And at last they're coming back to the stars.

So, please,
there is no need to recall
for they no longer are mine.

title: forced
paragraphs:
Pushed into consciousness
against my will.
Hearing my heart beating -
I never asked for it.

Forced to continue,
i cannot stop now;
that's what i'm told
when i don't even want

this body,
this mind,
this breathing,
this life.

title: expansion
paragraphs:
I miss the time when my world was smaller,
when a trip to the garden was exciting enough,
when the city centre seemed a million metres away,
when it was thrilling, to go to the next district.
The grass was just greener then.

But as I put myself more in the world
and it gradually grew bigger and bigger,
the colour stretched and thinned across more familiar places,
and inevitably lost its former saturation

I miss the time when my world was smaller
and simpler,
even with the fear of the later discovered unknown.
I suppose it used to be more vivid.

title: verbs
paragraphs:
I look
and i see

and i ache
and i long
and i crave
and i dream
and i think
and i wish
that i could

title: ostatni dzień lata
paragraphs:
I tak to się kręci
I tak to bywa

Kolej odwrócona
Dusza nieżywa

Co chciała żyć
A zamiast szyć
Swego losu nić
Zerwano ją

Ostatnie lato tego życia
A świat się kręci
Bez pamięci
Teraz przychodzi jesień

title: the last day of summer
paragraphs:
And so it spins,
and it is what it is

Order reversed,
a spirit dead

who wanted
to shape the thread of its life
and let it untie-
Instead it was broken.

The last summer of this life,
the world still spins
with no memory.
Now autumn comes.

title: seasons
paragraphs:
You first saw summer.
Shining sun,
golden rays,
warm days.

Your first summer,
I didn't know you.
I was not there yet.
I wonder how it was?

I first saw autumn.
Shining raindrops,
golden leaves,
cold days.

My first autumn,
you knew me.
You were there already.
I wonder how you remembered it?

You last saw summer.
Shining LEDs,
Golden med fluids,
long, painful days.

This last autumn,
was my first without you.
You're not here anymore.
I wonder how I'll remember it?
I wonder how it will be?

title: time
paragraphs:
As I'm going back I'm thinking
About how what we needed
Was just a bit more time

A bit more time to talk
A bit more time to understand
A bit more time to reconnect
A bit more time to be

But we were not given the time
To talk
To understand
To reconnect

You
were not given the time

title: scraps
paragraphs:
Fragmented memory,
bits and pieces of remembered conversations.
All the people met, all the visited places
making up this cluster of identity.

title: dichotomy
paragraphs:
Heart deep down,
mind cracked open.

title: patience
paragraphs:
I'm a patient person,
I don't mind the long summer days,
I don't mind the neverending queues,
I don't mind the red traffic light.

Growing old doesn't scare me,
I don't dread seeing the first grey hair.
I'm not afraid of letting go
nor of time slipping through my hands.
Because for me life is nothing but a waiting game.

I long to see the happy little tree
on my way to work,
and then watch it fade away.
And so everyday.

And I can and i do wait
from day to day,
from week to week,
from year to year,
from birth to death.

title: handmade
paragraphs:
The legend says
that God laughed out loud
when his first petty humans
dared to decide.

The legend says
that he couldn't stop the smile
to crawl on his face
when he sent them both to die.

He knew all along
that Eve would eat the fruit
'cause if he's all knowing
how could he not?

Yet still he shook his head
and pointed his finger
made an angry face
and ordered them to leave.

But the joke is on him,
we can’t be in hell.
For I’ve grown my own
Eden with you on this Earth.
Our handmade heaven.

title: old love
paragraphs:
There are times
when I almost forget
the oldest childhood friend
and the first shy love.

And then there are times
when all I can think of
are my oldest childhood friend
and my first shy love.

Oh how I wish I could stop them
from re-entering my mind.

But I just can't help it;
remnants of love are forever.

title: alarm clock
paragraphs:
Sometimes
it's easy to forget
your death

Until the thought
wakes me up
better than an alarm clock

title: happy birthday
paragraphs:
At the crack of dawn
You would have been twenty-four

One year on August eleventh
You would have been twenty-seven

I wonder how you would be
On your birthday of thirty-three

Instead of growing older
You keep getting younger and younger

title: big dark brown blankets
paragraphs:
The big brown blankets live now on our TV room sofa
and they keep haunting me
when I look at pictures of our family cat.

(I took so many pictures of our family cat
around then -
I see now it was how I dealt with it.

It loves lying on those big dark brown blankets.
No wonder - they are soft and warm,
I like them very much too).

Because the thing is that
they were not there right before,
they appeared right after.

So now,
when I see those big dark brown blankets,
they keep reminding me of the before and after.

title: empty space
paragraphs:
We stare at your face
at the portrait attached to your grave,
and your name, and age
carved into the stone

As I am standing here
I can't help but remember
the empty space on the stone,
the empty space underneath

Both left there on purpose
as planned and discussed
We moved your name to the top of the stone
so that other names will fit later on

And I
will be the one
to put them there
Just under yours

In this exact place
I see myself standing
alone, on my own
Everyone else is under

And all that is missing
is me

The last one standing,
no more space left

title: five
paragraphs:
There's only three of us
But we had five plates

Normally there's only
One empty left

But we had five
Why? I asked

One for the stranger,
That I get

But one more also
For you, dead

title: chokeberry juice
paragraphs:
like the bitter aftertaste
after drinking chokeberry juice
lingering at the back of my mouth,
something lingers at the back of my mind

title: tint
paragraphs:
All the colours that make up life
swirling around,
carving the path.

Too long it took me to notice, that
all the colours that make up my life
are tinted by this thing in my mind.

title: your month
paragraphs:
I met you
I don't even remember how long ago.

We flirted
when I was no older than six years old.

How did you introduce yourself?
I was so young...
Do all kids think of you? Even know of you?
And do you stick with all the kids that do?

You made yourself at home
in my tiny growing brain
early enough
to now forever have a place to stay.

You're like
a recurring dream
(or I guess a nightmare
as some might prefer to call you).

Sometimes you're nothing more than a hum
in the background of my narrative.
But you still won't let me forget you
even on my best of days.

Other times you are
all. I. can. think. of.
... and your promise
of the swift release from any pain.

So, you're always there,
somewhere.

I don't think it's possible
to completely get rid of you
once you appear.
Uninvited, but desired after all those years.

I can't bring myself to hate
the idea of you.
There's just something oh, so sweet
in the possibility offered by you.

title: birthdays
paragraphs:
You're one, then two, then three
they watch you turn four and six
on your birthdays, more with each year

Some witness a lot of them,
if not all so far,
your family and such.

A few celebrated with a number of friends
who see only a couple of your years,
one, two, maybe three.

Do you ever wonder if the version of you
they remembered from your sixteenth birthday
is still alive, somewhere in their brains?

Shaped, evolved, morphed
into something beyond
what you ever could have become?

I do. I fear that if they met the person
that I actually became on this birthday
they wouldn't believe which one's me.

title: patchwork
paragraphs:
I was born with a thread and a needle
and a template to follow.

I first knitted the strands,
then the materials,
I built some clothes,
thinking of which pattern to actualise.
But then
it all came undone and loose

(through no-one else's fault but my own,
I ripped apart what I'd worked on,
I ripped the clothes and materials,
I pulled on the strands and the threads)
and I ended up
with this patchwork of a life.

title: suicide note
paragraphs:
I wrote a suicide note on my computer
I saved it on my desktop

Now, every time I open my computer
I see it staring back at me

I should probably delete it
but I don't think I want to

Just as I don't want to
to get rid of the thought itself

title: animal kingdom
paragraphs:
Why can a dog be just a dog,
why can a cat be just a cat,
why a bird can just be a bird,
while we have to be so much more than men?

Why can't a person be simply allowed
to only nap, walk, eat and laugh?

Why can all the others just be,
while we HAVE to do, to think, to achieve?

Is this the making of overgrown brains?
Is it all futile? Are we insane?

Or do other duties truly emerge
once a species learns its own name?

title: the picture
paragraphs:
Painting the canvas
I did not expect
the real picture
to be the mess on the pallet

title: receipts
paragraphs:
on the fist receipt I found
i saw you bought a gym pass
(I never knew you went to the gym)

right in the next compartment
was a London metro ticket
(from the very last trip you took)

finally, there was another receipt
just two months younger
(but quite a bit longer)

marking the beginning of the end
with the list of all these meds

title: window
paragraphs:
It scares me
what I found

Old conversations
I forgot I ever had

What scares me the most
though

is the version of me
staring back

from the digital window
to the past

title: pencil
paragraphs:
When learning to write
I held the pencil wrong

This caused my hand to cramp
since I held the pencil wrong

But I kept writing, to learn how to write
even if I was holding the pencil wrong

And now, after all those years
of holding the pencil wrong

I have a crooked finger
in my dominant hand

I'm not exaggerating
the literal bone structure changed

A permanent reminder
that all those years
no adult noticed
I was holding the pencil wrong

title: oldest friend
paragraphs:
What will it take
to get you out of my head,
my oldest, uninvited friend?

I've known you for too long
I don't even remember the world
without you

I love you, I hate you,
I can't get rid of you

Even on the best of days
you still have a tight hold on my brain

Tainting my view
making sweet days blue

title: medicine
paragraphs:
i cannot
for the life of me
swallow this pill

not the one
that I'm taking
every morning

but this one of
bitter realisation
of what it means
to be taking those pills

title: make it make sense
paragraphs:
this makes no sense
this feeling in my chest

everything's okay
so why is this still playing in my brain

i'm so fed up
with this nonsense

i don't know if i can take it
much longer

title: almost
paragraphs:
when the pain outweighs the fear
I feel closer to you, my dear

not quite there yet, but there were times
when it was almost, almost enough...

were they enough, though, to call them
this term reserved for the hopeless?

i don't think so
I think it doesn't count
until the pain is finally enough
